text: Delivery drivers obviously deserve basic rights like sick and holiday pay. It shouldn't take a tragedy for DPD – or any other company – to get the message. https://t.co/1nJM9TkS0r
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: @Keir_Starmer And he's right to take the UK's obligations to Northern Ireland seriously. We need a firm guarantee that there will be no checks, controls or physical infrastructure at the border. Vague promises won't cut it.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: No deal would be the worst possible deal for our jobs, our rights at work and for the NI peace process. @Keir_Starmer is right to push for a meaningful vote in parliament - the government has ruled out too much to negotiate the best deal.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Soaring rents, crippling student debt and the longest pay squeeze since Napoleonic times. But yeah, socialism is the problem. https://t.co/hoYYeDnOHO
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: The French produce their own passports for national security reasons - and now they'll produce British passports too. Govt blaming EU rules is a smokescreen - they could easily take a stand for UK jobs.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Government must now make sure the rest of our hardworking public servants get the pay rise they've earned - and fund it properly.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: The NHS deal is a good step towards fair pay for hardworking staff. Their dedication has kept the service running through unprecedented pressures and cuts.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: The NUT's (@NEUnion) campaign against school cuts won £1.3bn in new money for schools and got 750k people to change their votes. Huge credit to them and everyone who got involved! https://t.co/shY0y3rpBN
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: The living standards crisis is still going strong, even if today's fall in prices eases the pressure a bit. Millions of workers haven't had a proper pay rise in years. Government must up its game. https://t.co/oxLYMOsjxN
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Delighted to contribute to the #FirstAmongEquals display at the @FoundlingMuseum. I chose a telegram from a foster mum to her ‘darling’ Sam and a cold, clinical hospital letter to another foster parent. https://t.co/S27qvmRH6W
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Very sad to hear about the death of Brenda Dean. A tough women, leader of SOGAT, who took the fight to Rupert Murdoch at Wapping.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Great to be at #britishkebabawards. Fab speech by @ibrahim_dogus celebrating the contribution of takeaway workers all over the country. Great food tonight too!
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Good to meet @MichelBarnier in Brussels this morning. Told him that we need a level playing field for workers' rights, no undercutting and protection for the Good Friday Agreement. https://t.co/q8uKMNcdch
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Good negotiators don’t box themselves in - today's EU guidelines show why. The PM's red lines are getting in the way of a jobs-first, rights-first Brexit.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Strange to see David Davis backing a trade deal with "zero tariffs on services", given that services aren't subject to tariffs. Our Brexit secretary should really know this stuff. https://t.co/RJtp3ZlCdh
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Huge thanks to all those who've stepped up this week to keep our services running in nightmare conditions. Though someone needs to buy Ben some long trousers! https://t.co/Zx41KKyP4v
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: This speech changes nothing - more pie-in-the-sky logic from govt. We're still headed for a hard Brexit that undermines jobs, rights and the Good Friday Agreement.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: The PM wants working people to "face the fact" that the UK won't get everything it wants in negotiations. But she still refuses to level with them about what the losses will be.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Touring the studios this morning, Chris Grayling admitted the UK won't “have everything that we might like” from the deal.  In other words, jobs are at stake.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Less than a year ago, Theresa May promised the Brexit trade deal would offer the “same benefits” as we have now. Expect her to break that promise in today’s speech.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Very sorry today for workers at Maplin and Toys R Us. Public investment and stronger workers' rights can help guarantee great jobs for everyone, wherever they are.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: 20 years on from the Good Friday agreement, it’s sickening to see hard Brexiteers like Boris Johnson undermining it. My latest for the @guardian: https://t.co/JUxhSJULuz
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Let's be crystal clear. Threat of hard border (and unravelling of Good Friday Agreement) is because of the government's self-defeating red lines - and the reckless demands of hard Brexiteers
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: This morning Boris Johnson carelessly compared the Irish border to a London borough boundary. Now it’s revealed he doesn’t think stopping a hard border is worth bothering about anyway https://t.co/a9pTIYOEID
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Planning to travel from Tottenham Court Road to Westminster this evening. Anyone know what the wait time at the border is like?
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: And solidarity to all @UCU members on the picket line today. Stay warm, stay strong! #USSStrike ❄️✊
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Whatever the weather where you are, stay safe today. Bosses shouldn't force staff to make dangerous journeys to get to work. #beastfromtheeast
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Staying in the single market currently looks like the best way to protect jobs, guarantee a level playing field for workers’ rights and safeguard the Good Friday Agreement
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Good to hear @keir_starmer on #marr saying Labour will support staying in customs union & is focussed on getting benefits of single market for UK post-Brexit
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: A hard Brexit spells disaster for the Good Friday Agreement. Great piece from Fintan O’Toole - we should all be worried https://t.co/dNlVKtckXZ
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: All solidarity to @ucu members on strike today. Strength of feeling among university staff (and students) is clear. Employers must commit to serious negotiations. #USSstrike https://t.co/Ovk18Fuwxx
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: So proud to work for @The_TUC. Our movement will always fight and win for working people. #TUC150 https://t.co/v5On9sv3SE
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: UK workers need a guarantee that their rights will keep pace with those across Europe - currently the best way to do that would be sticking with the Single Market. Let’s set the bar higher than “not a dystopia”.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: As David Davis promises a “race to the top” post-Brexit, his cabinet colleagues are chomping at the bit to slash workers’ rights. Government is clearly speaking with two heads.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Good to see. The best way we can currently see to protect rights at work into the future is staying in the single market. That’s what will prevent a race to the bottom. https://t.co/f7EQ4Ibk7X
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: It's clear as day: working people back the Working Time Directive. They don't want a Brexit that undermines paid hols, rest breaks and fair hours. https://t.co/eWrourt74a https://t.co/NJ9bJDp1Fa
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: I’ll be listening closely to what DD says tomorrow in Vienna. I suggest anyone worried about preserving our hard-won rights at work does the same.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Currently, the only way to make good on David Davis' promise not to scrap our rights at work after Brexit is to stay in the single market. Promises are nice, but guarantees are what workers need.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: David Davis' promise not to scrap our rights at work after Brexit would be more believable if he & his colleagues hadn't voted against putting such promises in the EU Withdrawal Bill
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: It seems David Davis will tell Austrian biz leaders tomorrow that no one is planning a bonfire of our rights at work after Brexit. Has he not been listening to Johnson & Gove?
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: PS: if you’re really interested in EU state aid rules, I thought this longer piece was interesting https://t.co/u1SVn7DOww
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Govt uses excuse of single market rules to stop it taking action to deliver better jobs we need. But clear that EU rules don't stop other countries supporting industry through national investment banks and better targeted state aid - see https://t.co/az7cMITp8p
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: And we need a National Investment Bank - like the TUC has been calling for since 2012 https://t.co/Hv86xZYdxH - building on the success of the Green Investment Bank before the Conservatives sold it off, and learning from Germany and other countries across the EU.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: For a start, more ambitious use of state aid to support regional development. The Germans spend three times the amount we do on supporting growth through state aid.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Currently, the best option to protect jobs and rights at work after Brexit looks like staying in the single market and customs union. But we also need more action from government right now to deliver more & better jobs.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Looking forward to talking about Brexit and the good jobs we need at Labour's National Policy Forum #npf18 tomorrow. I'll be making the case for a Brexit that delivers good jobs across the country
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: We want a UK where workers’ rights keep getting better. Boris Johnson is offering the opposite. My latest: https://t.co/nhlntWMkvJ
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: The foreign secretary is on record as an opponent of paid holiday, parental and redundancy rights - do you trust him?
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Today's speech from Boris is no olive branch. His divergence plans are all about scrapping hard-won rights to paid holidays, equal pay and safety at work.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: More evidence that ministers see Brexit as a chance to worsen our rights at work https://t.co/9h8Na9OI0s
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text:
RT @unitetheunion: Shocked by what you’ve seen on @c4dispatches? Then >>
SIGN: Premier Inn: Clean up your act! Help Unite stop the exploita…
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: @premierinn Britain’s largest hotel chain must sit down with @unitetheunion. There's no place for these types of working practices #Dispatches
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Shocking working conditions exposed at @premierinn - staff working extra hours unpaid to meet ridiculous targets #Dispatches
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: More proof that undermining workers’ rights is being discussed... https://t.co/OU82hrILnv
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Retail sector could be hit by a 20% rise in costs after Brexit, and 13% for car makers. Workers' jobs are on the line - govt must put all options back on the table.  https://t.co/Z9NdNpJq9G
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Ministers need to up their game. At very least, end the Undercutters’ Charter that means agency workers can be paid less than permanent staff doing the same job. #TaylorReview
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Govt response to Taylor Review still leaves 1.8 million workers excluded from key protections. And doesn't tackle hire and fire culture in the gig economy.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: These measures won't change the balance of power in the modern workplace. The government's taken a baby step when it needed to take a giant leap. https://t.co/u5p7wqMFTD #TaylorReview
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: And to honour their memory (and cos we're still not there yet) I'm recommitting to fight for equality for working women everywhere #stillmarching
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text:
Today I'm remembering women like Julia Varley, trade unionist and suffragette, who fought for the vote at huge cost to themselves #100years 
https://t.co/2GbkcKMYTA
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Many congrats to @NUJofficial and Buzzfeed staff, whose application for union recognition can now go ahead. Ruling by the Central Arbitration Committee here: https://t.co/RganxqS7Jj
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: The PM has to break free of Brexit extremists in her party and put working people first. And the best way to protect jobs, investment & rights at work is through single market and customs union.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: By ruling out customs union, the government's choosing to put up barriers to UK trade with Europe after #Brexit. It'll be bad for jobs, bad for investment & bad for business https://t.co/IMPS9Sic6X
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Great to see Michael D Higgins this morning. And to commemorate Eva Gore-Booth, an iconic Irish suffragist, artist and labour activist. @PresidentIRL https://t.co/zm0kbeVsX3
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: We hear endless news about internal ministerial squabbles, but little about how to protect workers' jobs and rights. Time to shape up.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text:
Our car workers are some of the most dedicated out there. The government is letting them down: 
https://t.co/ucFjWHSxFI

users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: The #Capita profit warning is really worrying. That’s why the @The_TUC is calling for an urgent risk assessment of all large outsourcing firms. We can’t afford another Carillion.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: To end sexual harassment, we need to tackle misuse of non-disclosure agreements. Scaring workers into staying silent can't become common practice. https://t.co/lenrl8sikN
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: This is down to brave work by Ryanair pilots themselves and real persistence from @BALPApilots. Huge credit to all involved.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Great that #Ryanair have recognised a union for pilots - at long last! Wherever working people need a voice, unions can stand up for them. https://t.co/7Mt0S75SVv

users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: RT @FrancesOGrady: Just as we warned: this leaked govt impact analysis lists deregulating employment rights after Brexit as an “opportunity…
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Just as we warned: this leaked govt impact analysis lists deregulating employment rights after Brexit as an “opportunity”. But no-one voted to lose their breaks or holiday pay! https://t.co/HQ5NEsQ4hw
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Today we remember but we must also do more. We must challenge anti-semitism and bigotry wherever we see them. #HolocaustMemorialDay
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: On my way to Chester for #bbcaq tonight. Hope you can tune in - Radio 4 at 8pm. https://t.co/GHqlQwHVQb
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text:
Great result for @cwunews members! Just shows there is #powerinaunion

(PS this Arsenal fan is still sore about Alexis Sanchez...) https://t.co/W6zcHVScLu
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Absolutely sickening. Young women groped and harassed at a men-only black tie fundraiser. What century are we living in? https://t.co/5YCb4uJtxk
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Canada-style Brexit deal would be bad for jobs, public services and rights at work. Government must drop self-defeating red lines! And put all options on the table - including single market membership #peston
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: @stonewalluk Employers must adopt zero-tolerance policies on transphobic bullying and discrimination. And government should legislate to protect workers from third party abuse.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

users.name: Frances O'Grady

users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: The single market is the only realistic option that guarantees our rights at work long-term. Me for @thetimes this morning. https://t.co/2LQZ8S042C
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: This NHS crisis isn’t a one off - it's the direct result of years of cuts. That's why I've joined with other union leaders to demand that government properly fund our NHS. https://t.co/ZxrgZbLQgc
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Govt must step in to protect jobs and services, and explain how they let this mess happen in the first place.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Carillion liquidation leaves thousands of jobs at risk, as well as vital public services & infrastructure. Textbook example of the failures of privatisation and outsourcing.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Good to talk to @PickardJE about why Brexit mustn't be treated as an opportunity to slash workers rights. https://t.co/jAZamX1U4k https://t.co/bYIcUQdMyV
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC

text: New figures show just how bad the last decade has been for workers' incomes. Alarm bells should be ringing in Westminster. https://t.co/gFy9vt5eDj

users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Congratulations to the growing union of McDonalds workers standing together to win real change at work with @bfawu1 - And they're only getting started! https://t.co/HG6RmYXUt5 https://t.co/KWmfyVtqeY
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Another year, another rail fare increase. UK commuters will be envying their continental cousins, who travel to work on reasonable fares. We need to take our railways back into public hands https://t.co/qwZiBQtTUC
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Happy new year, everyone! 150 years from the founding of the TUC, the world of work is changing fast. In 2018 we'll keep fighting for great jobs, decent pay and a Brexit that works for working people. #TUC150
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: I see ministers have published their Brexit impact assessments. Looks to me like they've just printed off Wikipedia pages on bits of the economy. I know it's the end of term, but we can do better than this.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: 100 years of manufacturing at Cummins in Lincolnshire now under threat. These dedicated workers deserve more respect. Please support & sign @unitetheunion's petition https://t.co/1kqUgXBLdv
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Real vindication for @GMB_union's campaign on Uber, and for their argument that Uber is a transport company, not just a tech company.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Tech should be making work better, not dragging us back to the kind of work practices we fought off decades ago.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: The courts confirming what we've always known: Uber is a cab firm. Time for them to get their house in order. https://t.co/FRkOfFhWyW
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Watch out, the Brexiteers might be coming for your paid holidays - my @guardian column on this weekend's ministerial plot: https://t.co/unDgiiksMn
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Constructive meeting with @michelbarnier in Brussels today https://t.co/3iZNbBDPOh
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: We warned you. Leopards don’t change their spots. Don’t let them take away our hard won rights. Back the TUC campaign for a Brexit deal that puts working people first https://t.co/2HSjNUNOQP
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: The PM promised not to weaken workers' rights after Brexit. This will test if she can keep her word, or if she's a prisoner of extremists in her own cabinet.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Millions of workers - esp part-time women - got paid holidays because of this rule. And it stops bosses from forcing us to work ridiculous hours.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: I've seen reports of a ministerial plot to scrap the Working Time Directive. This is a straight-up attack on our rights at work.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: We're ready to help @BALPApilots get a fair deal for pilots, and to help get recognised unions for all Ryanair staff.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Strong trade union campaigning at Ryanair is paying off. Who’s next? More bosses must do the right thing to get a union voice for fair wages and treatment at work
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Unlikely No10 justification for this would stand up in court https://t.co/wDlQvX6AEs (another reason to thank unions. @unisontweets’ win means women facing discrimination no longer have to pay up front for justice)
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Ran into @Feargal_Sharkey at the Irish Embassy tonight. Last time I saw him a few years back at an anti-fascist rally in Sedgefield working men's club & before that 1979 with the Undertones at Factory in Manchester. Good man. https://t.co/PvGtAydhUt
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: He is sending a clear signal that British workers will pay the price for the government’s bungled negotiations.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Make no mistake: a CETA-style deal could weaken our rights, falling behind the rest of Europe, leaving workers no way to enforce their rights.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: David Davis let the cat out of the bag on #Marr. He thinks a deal on ILO standards is good enough for British workers. WRONG.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: We need a deal with the EU that defends jobs, rights & public services. Trade deals like CETA aren't the answer. It’s time politicians put the interests of working people first. #Brexit

text: No cherry-picking. After seven years of pay cuts, ALL our public servants deserve the payrise they've worked for. Fully funded. #Budget2017

users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Last year, the TUC's @unionlearn skills programme helped 250,000 workers upgrade their skills. Good to hear the Chancellor recognises its value. #Budget2017

users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: This isn’t the investment boost we need to drive great jobs and higher wages. The Chancellor must try harder. #Budget2017

users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: Right. Being Chancellor isn’t a spectator sport. We’re in the middle of a living standards crisis and working people need real change, not half measures. #Budget2017

users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: This year alone, the public sector pay cap has reduced spending power in England by £8.5 billion. The Chancellor needs to act.
users.description: General Secretary of the Trades Union Congress @The_TUC
users.name: Frances O'Grady

text: The pay cap is a false economy. It's driven up in-work poverty, which means less money spent on high streets and in local businesses. #Budget2017

users.name: Frances O'Grady
